mxoI3FLqur0ccxeuMqoM_Q.text: good food, finally somewhere independent and tasty to eat around waterloo! - bit pricey and terrible terrible TERRIBLE service though. bar chap couldn't have been more depressing if he'd had tears running down his face and a hankie in his hand to be honest.

7PcwI3jlfr_LBruwJRBefg.text: Nice place on a side street, nearish to that Sainsbury's where you wait for Busses South.A really fantastic selection of beers-- belgians, ales, 4(!) ciders (OK, 2 ciders, a scrumpy, and a perry, but still) which rotates. good food-- though you'll need to arrive early on, say, Sunday if you want a roast-- they're often gone by 3.This is a real hidden gem in the wasteland of Waterloo-area pubs and whatnot (I'm looking at you, Firehouse)

JUu686c_Yhg_2w7BiwH_5A.text: We were only in here for a sneaky pint, but what we did see, we liked. Busy, warm and friendly on a blisteringly cold Winter night, the service was quick and we liked the young and chirpy crowd.Refreshingly well priced for a pub a stones throw from Waterloo station. That's the beauty of this pub, it's squirrelled down a backstreet and so only those in the know make it here. Mind you, a lot of people seemed to be in the know on Friday night!The food menu looked reasonable so I'll try to get back here for some grub and stay a little bit longer. Will return.

Q29XS4Ocuc-d5TdMNenH3A.text: If you're in need of a beer or a quick bite in the Waterloo area, you could do worse than pop into the White Hart.  It's tucked away down a backstreet and therefore off the all-too-well trodden path.It's not a huge place but has a heap of tables scattered around the central bar.  The service is quick and there's a substantial selection of beers on tap.  A quick glance at the menu hinted a range of pub food's on offer.  The prices are more than reasonable, especially considering its proximity to the Southbank and Waterloo Station.

Uab3Ky3Luirg29ghvp7IeQ.text: This is one of our go-to locals because they have Franziskaner on Tap for me and it's a 4 minute walk from our house. Unfortunately it can get VERY crowded with the "after work - catch a pint before I get on the train at waterloo" crowd and service can be a bit slow, but at most other times it's a nice little place to go. Not the coziest and we haven't eaten there so I can't speak for the food, but it's always looked pretty good on others' plates.

LQH8tvuIeZ3vYP52xnRHgA.text: I can't tell you how many times since i've moved here I've passed this place and each time going "I must remember to come back here"I FINALLY DID! Its really close walk to Waterloo, yet nice and secluded and quiet.What a lovely spot. I walked in for a last drink late on a Friday night, but the atmosphere was delicious here. There's a lovely young, chatty crowd. Very inviting, which I like.GREAT selection of beers at the bar, genuinely nothing I love more than choosing carefully my ONE pint. The service was great as well!Its got the great decor of a comfy pub to me, with massive church style candles on some of the tables and the windows draped in fairy lights. It was a little noisy, but hey its a Friday, I'm no begrudger, when a place is jammed and people are having fun. All it did was encourage me to come back again earlier or on a Sunday for some Food, which I will.White Hart's got a spot in my heart anyway.

njuqK4d7xWd6tCL6K0uXhw.text: To get to the White Hart from Waterloo station is about 100 paces but feels a million miles away. Suddenly, just a block away from the busy roads and imposing railway architecture are two or three beautiful little Victorian terraced steets and their warm local pub. It's a time-warp place. The street looks like the opening scene in 1984 and the pubs jukebox doesn't look changed since 1964. Fortunately the pub grub is up-to-date with some noveau burger options to go with the great value baguettes, bangers and mash and snack platters. The beer selection is good too... at least 3 Belgians on tap plus real ales, Aspalls and some Sierra too.It's a small busy place full of good people. Such a rarity in Waterloo that you can ask the question... 'Why tell everyone else about this gem?'Another question you can ask is... 'How did 2 pints of the same ale come to £6.15?'. That one baffled us all night.

LNMO4TeFLh3c54xUXibHLQ.text: I went there for lunch as we found it on yelp as a pub with not bad reviews.  This place is very small and pretty quiet. Seems more like coffee shop than pub. I wanted a cezar salad sandwich but I got just a cezar salad (but it was my husband mistake) . The salad wasnt tasty at all. Very creamy and had fish in it. I didnt see it at the menu but why would you put fish in chicken ceazar salad ? It was also pretty expensive.

hcScgDiTlyP1u3i4TgpSNw.text: Looking for a pub to have a quick drink with friends who had just arrived from America. Needed atmosphere, good drink selection and a bite to hold us over until dinner and it was the perfect choice for all three. I loved that they had four ciders on draft, along with a wonderful selection of ales. It started snowing and it was a wonderfully magical moment tucked away in a warm cozy pub watching the snowfall. Will definitely go back for a roast and to bring visitors!

uF6Lim50l6VG3aCc22MmCg.text: So I know this place generally has great reviews so maybe I went on an off night... Showed up on a Wednesday evening with a friend around 730/8...immediately turned off by the terrible smell of the place (i.e. not a"cute British pub" must but a "leaky toilet and BO" stench).  The place was annoyingly crowded and also out of fish & chips which is what we came for...Meh.  Been to much better pubs.

Fdg8NHahr5k7vgnTfsrEgw.text: I spent 3 months studying at King's College and lived right next door. Simply put, this is my favorite pub of all time. Good beer selection, good food, and an amazing environment easily made it my go-to spot for a pint or 4. i really can't think of any negatives about it. Definitely worth going to if you're in need of food or drink at a cozy spot in the waterloo area!

MRoQnQOaabBl4-BkQNVy7w.text: My favourite pub in SE. It offers a variety of delicious/superior pub food (cooked freshly and 'with love'). Special menus (3 courses) are offered for a fixed price of about £ 12. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel home. As semi-Bavarian I can especially recommend the selections of beers (traditional ales, lagers from the Continent and German wheat beer). AND YES: The place is usually very crowded (with locals working or living in SE1) but that's an indication of quality and makes it easier to get in touch with people!

9GWfMAuAOlkt4MAZ4eZjlA.text: Fantastic Sunday roast!  Hub had pork w crackin, son had aged beef and I had fish n chips.  All dishes were freshly made and delicious.  Service was excellent!!

Jjjg3jV3wQ3rcB96KYBPwg.text: Corner pub, gets crowded with students, some look young but no id was asked for. Tables fill up very quickly. Small outside drinking area. Real ale on sale, Doombar, London Pride, Wandle. Wheelchair accessable.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

JXZCgPptz1H60P9j4v_eUw.text: Seems a nice little boozer a stones throw from Waterloo station in a quaint old area of London. Fairly busy but never overwhelming. Only stayed for a quick drink when I've visited so can't really offer much more in terms of a review but service is quick thanks to a well designed central bar, plenty of choice when it comes to drinks and a nice decor. Worth sticking your head in

TpiY5cxRUiKTQRHXRMArAg.text: This is a cracking little pub in Waterloo. It's a safe bet if the Kigs Arms on Roupell Street is full. Nice decor, friendly locals and some good ale on tap (well, when i say good ale I mean London Pride - I like it), served in a proper old man beer glass to which was nice. This pub feels like a local. Really cosy, friendly. They do food too, although I only stopped in here for lunch so I'm really not sure if the food is any good. I'd happily come back here again, and to be honest, I think when I last came here, I preferred it to the King's Arms up the road.

D7-WxNLVLbP34wKqguAc2A.text: Surprisingly, this pub doesn't feel like it's a stone's throw from Waterloo station at all. It definitely has a local, intimate feel to it, which is heightened by the fact that is tiny and was completely packed to the gills on a Friday night.  Good ales on tap, and although we didn't eat here, the food looked pretty tasty and was reasonably priced.

uxu3x33mwNiGGe-mu9Yo_A.text: We enjoyed this place for lunch. I would say the enjoyment was mostly from friends and colleagues, not the service. There is a decent selection of beer on tap, including strawberry cider which was enjoyed by some female colleagues. We came for lunch and even with a group of 10 they would take the order at the table. We had to line up, order and pay at the bar. This seemed to be a very slow process. While some of us were in line, others walked through the door and were served before us, so it was a bit frustrating. Because some of us had to wait to order our food because of people cutting, when the food was served to our table it also came in two waves. Half the group was done eating by the time the rest of us received our food. Once the food did arrive it was very good. I had the burger with Monterey Jack (no bacon) and chips. The burger was served on a really nice roll, though it could have been a bit thicker. The chips were fantastic, thick slices of potatoes fried just right. The pub has good atmosphere about it. The furniture is worn and chairs a bit scraggly contributing to more comfortable feel, but not posh. The walls are graced with artful photos of various tube stations. Finally, because we paid for our food when we ordered it did make it very easy leave once we were done. There was no waiting for the bill and there was worry about leaving a tip for the service. The food and atmosphere is right, just don't be in a rush!

5XnCOeOc7ACt50UuaMevnQ.text: Went there last night since it was the closest to where i was staying. I was blown away by their menu. The burger was awesome. Wanted to try bangers and mash but i was too full by then. Great place, little cramped when its peak hours i guess. Had to wait and scavenge a seat. Friendly staff. Lots of beers on tap. I personally would go just to eat and try out the rest of the menu. Overall great place to have a pint and the food is to die for.

lw4p8j8w2E75u8vitlJvnQ.text: Great little backstreet boozer,make the effort the wander from waterloo as its worth it. Loads of choice for drinkers,high end ciders,frulli an lagers. The food is top notch to. Friendly staff add to the whole package. be careful though you can end up drunk when leaving!!!......

h35nciu2n3AuQqnpJQBwbQ.text: A great little pub tucked away near Waterloo station. In the summer everyone stands outside because of the location you are not stuck in traffic fumes; the roads are small and quiet and cars rarely drive past. They do a reasonable pub menu and the drink prices are normal for London

INgctuQvCDDRyZAftKNZKA.text: This is hidden away in a series of small streets, yet very accessible from the Waterloo area. We were looking for an English pub to eat at, and most of them in the main Waterloo area were absolutely slammed, so it's a relieve to find this little place.We walked in and they didn't have any tables, but they were really friendly so we hung out at the bar for a little bit until one opened up. They actually helped us get a seat, which was very nice of them. Most people just seemed to be here for pre-game -- get a drink, have a chat, and leave. We actually were interested in having dinner, and we ordered a caesar salad, the fish and chips, and one of the Sunday roasts.Caesar salad was, well, caesar salad. It would've been quite normal except for the little fillets of anchovies. Nice touch. The fish and chips was huge. It was a big fish fillet, and it was fresh and delicious. The mister really enjoyed it (guess we didn't go to the UK for nothing!). However, my sunday roast beef was so-so. The gravy was quite bland, and the meat was pretty tough until I get to the stuffing. At least the stuffing was good.The environment was friendly, the food was decent, and the price wouldn't break your bank. This is definitely a cute little pub to visit if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

WOiC9H-JhT2PdiFYiu4sUg.text: Fantastic British pub! We came here during the early evening and the place was bumping! Everyone had obviously just left work and had grabbed a table early, however, we didn't mind standing at the bar and conversing with the locals.I wish we could have tried the food! The menu looked stellar and prices were affordable.

I3amk8OgMb817dRr55rMPQ.text: The food was bland but the drinks were fast despite the full house.  Wish there was more seasoning and inspiration to the food.

_P91dwPfyu3wstLokHUaMw.text: Maybe I should have given it 4 stars but it was quite good.It was a laid back friendly pub. I had drinks and ordered a Fish & Chips. No complaints. The staff was friendly, the drinks were good and the food was above average.I would return..

K81kqFcQeUdzXGfqpYd62A.text: Thank you yelp for sending me here. Lucky day...great weather I was hungry this was #1 in the hood. Great food. I got the Rueben nicely done. My daughter got a burger and was very happy. Staff was great. Made good recommendations for beers and other things to see in the area. Very nice clean place. Great staff

oXIN8t9XeOY0kXGI9mIUjQ.text: Lovely pub on a back road in Waterloo!  I didn't eat here, but it was a cozy spot for drinks after dinner, and the service was kind.

uBEp84VU7Uwho6zXksMiCA.text: Tucked away in a side street near Waterloo station is this lovely little pub. We went there for team lunch and absolutely loved it. It is beautiful, with a traditional decor and massive windows that allow you to look outside and enjoy the sun but also avoid the cold in the winter. When it's warmer outside you can also sit outside and have a great time in the sun. The food was amazing, everyone loved their meal and you can pick the set £10 menu and enjoy two courses for a price less than what you'd get one normal main for. I would definitely recommend having your lunch there if you're in the area and it may even become your new local!

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. The pub itself
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Squid
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Soup

iQlZLt6D-CfDqzSScrx-cw.text: Absolutely perfect scotch eggs... warm, runny center, and a  great selection of frequently changing  beer too. One to bookmark for my next visit.

vXKt3eNCXD6UDjNkVUmsNw.text: English pubs and I are starting to become good friends - something I had never thought would happen.  Coming here for lunch was not my idea, but I was too hungry to protest. As soon as you walk into this place, the smell of mouldy mop overwhelms you - something I have come to accept at these places, either mouldy mop or bathroom - i'll pick mouldy mop please...Sitting down in a near empty pub during weekday lunch hours plummeted my confidence in this choice, but at this point, there was nothing we can do. I picked up their 2 for £20 lunch specials where two lunch items and two drinks (beer too) will cost you £20 and almost went for some of stuff on the menu when my eyes came across the regular menu that had Pork Chorizo burger - erm...i'll take that for £11. My colleague also had his eyes on the pastrami sandwich for £6 so we decided to split the two. GREAT IDEA! I was so happily surprised that the food here is actually quite awesome. The burger was juicy and flavourful dripping with caramelized onions while the pastrami sandwich was the bomb. The pastrami covered in peppercorn was intense in flavour and paired nicely with the pickled red vegetables and coleslaw. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I walked away extremely satisfied. The only glitch in the whole experience was when two of our coworkers realized that they both got items from the lunch special and didnt realize it and when they tried to ask for the free drinks (each menu special on its own are just under £10) the dude said no. That was kinda sad.

tE7ALCCLx1-lpI0jwzv9Qw.text: "You can't stand here, there is no room, you need to go inside!""Well, I was just walking past but ok"..."Pint of Beck's please"*barman coughs in to hand, studies phlegm, wipes on other hand, wipes both hands on crotch, picks up glass and pours me a pint...."You can't sit here""Why are there chairs here?""You're in the way. You should try outside."Charming little shithole

kGt4-Pprwmdddf1W_mHgqQ.text: This is an excellent pub with a good selection of ales and great food. Its location is a winner as it is a short walk to Waterloo Station. It's easy to assume you will only find chains in the area around the station and South Bank Centre but this place is worth the extra few minutes walk.

yZlgD8UoXpqWTNmt56lf5g.text: Not my favorite watering hole exactly.Between dealing with an unhappy-to-be-at-work mocha skinned missy and waiting 5 minutes to be served 3 pints (clear bar, no queue, mind you) this White Hart is one miserable venue.The ground floor is small enough to not need so many damn tables and chairs. Honestly, have we a furniture hoarding problem?The proprietor could also benefit from a few management lessons - I'd recommend starting with human resourcing: your staff should be selling and serving, not testily shepherding guests into your miserable 2x4 feet smoking pen and playing safety patrol on Cornwall Road.This ragtag operation is truly giving White Hart a bad name.

WEls_4uN1X9miQfJ9jFGQQ.text: Nicely hidden away behind the IMAX and Waterloo station - a small walk from the south bank but still a proper pub. Space is limited when busy but a great food menu and nice staff mean I would return. Tried the tapas style bar snacks on my visit- all nicely sized and tasty (pics above) - they are around a fiver each but you can get any 3 for £12- I particularly recommend the sweet potato wedges- very chunky and delicious. Crowd seemed to be locals going for after work drinks as it was even popular on a Monday eve.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Pan fried chorizo
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Seriously yum sweet potato wedges

sHSVe_OgG-nGyCXVxi6nnA.text: Absolutely great pub.  It is very basic but spacious. The menu is not extensive but good choices abound.  We started with the squid appetizer, a perfectly flash field plate go lightly breaded delicate morsels.  Topped with a light pepper sauce it was served piping hot.  We ordered for mains the burger with chips ( entirely perfect)and the steak with ""Yorky" (Yorkshire pudding) and a side of seasonal vegetables.  The meat was flavorful and properly cooked.  Having first visited Britain 41 years ago, I somehow avoided Yorkshire pudding.  While this was probably fine, I will wait 41 years to try it again.  Great selections of beverages and service was very prompt.  This is not your choice for a major celebration, but it is a great place for a decent meal.

XJPfwGJVH-T__XgPAhhr4A.text: Boxing Day miracle find - the pie franchise restaurant was closed, and we lucked into this perfect pub. Amazing scotch egg, with yolk still a bit runny. But the "pie" de resistance was the steak, pancetta and ale pie, served with a gorgeous gravy and nice roasted veg and mash. Great local place that promotes local, sustainable and natural British ingredients.

-j0VCOZuEI_BDf1IzEOu-A.text: Stopped in for some fish and chips and a couple pints. The woman behind the bar was very attentive and helpful. Very nice part of town to walk around when you're all done.

xJ1aGTqzJZj1UyJ0IoBHxQ.text: While moving my daughter into Grad School at nearby Kings College we first saw this pub from the window of her Stamford St Apartment. After a 6 hour flight delay from the USA and loading her luggage into her new living quarters  we were both ready for a Pint and then some. It was a Friday evening and a good sized crowd. Good selection of beer and ale so we ordered away. Bartenders were all nice and helpful to the new "Americans" in the bar. They had several English Cask Ales plus Peroni, Carlsburg, Euro Bud, Franziskaner and some other I don't remember.  The beer flowed and we met lots of people who were all very friendly. Im sure my daughter is a regular there by now!

7nsOQgGiO0fl3zPDkVbgCQ.text: The place to go after an audition at the 1901 Arts Club. If these Are the usual punters to be found here, it's a young, succesful group. Good mood, nice music! Cheers!

OYq9_imIjopYkLdJRtIBWw.text: My favorite pub in the entire world, the White Hart is a gem of the Southbank area. Located on Cornwall Road, just one blocks south of the Waterloo tube stop, the White Hart is a quintessential British pub. The big wooden tables are great for groups, while the small, cozy nooks are perfect for grabbing for a drink with that special someone :)I recommend going in the afternoons, as it can be hard to get a table after 6 or so. Plus, during lunch time they have a great special where you can get a sandwich and a pint for only £5. They have a terrific selection of beers on tap, including some of my personal favorites: Peroni, Leffe Blonde, Hoegaarden and Fruli (an amazing strawberry beer).

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. front of the White Hart

a2sXZXfoE3Ni-wdf87GXOw.text: We had a great time in London and I enjoyed visiting many pubs.  The last day my wife and I visited White Hart and so glad we did.  Like other reviews on it, while it's in Waterloo it feels like it's not.  Tucked away from Waterloo station and the busyness of that area, that small walk makes you feel like you've entered into a whole other neighborhood.  Good service, solid food, and great beer.  My wife's pear cider was one of the best we've had in a while too.  Thanks for the last impression of London White Hart!

O_eBBqKt-kFfVu_x3U9x0w.text: If you are looking for traditional English food and drink this is hands down the spot. I love that this pub serves beer in a caste (something that is extremely difficult to find in the United States) and the bartenders were knowledgeable about their drinks. Everyone was pretty friendly and the fish and chips were phenomenal. My boyfriend had the meat pie and that was very good too. To be honest it was a little difficult to find food that I liked in England (other than my family's cooking :]) but this place truly left a good impression. Although the menu was small everything was cooked and served very well. In terms of the menu being traditional I think that when most people go to an English pub they do expect fish and chips, meat pie, some sort of burger and roast. The burger on their menu was also very good; I was pleasantly surprised. This place is a must on my list the next time I am in London.

KdZtvuRkTeuGxqZsrlXbUA.text: Came here for our first night out in London and we had a blast! It was so much fun and the bartenders Victoria and the two other men were very helpful, funny and more then happy to talk to us about London and what it's like as well as where to eat and do! The drinks I tried was the apple fritzer and another orange critic one; they were both delicious! Overall this was an amazing fun place on our first night out and we are definitely coming again (our flat is a block away!) We met amazing locals, Yessica and Jack who helped make this night memorable! Would recommend this small pub to anyone (:

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Met Jack and Yasmine!
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

o15N7_zW_rs-cNYnBeCJfQ.text: Grabbed dinner here based on the cuisine mentioned in previous reviews. Wild boar & Chorizo burger was fantastic. Cheeseburger was great they forgot the cheese but quickly fixed it with a smile. Friendly staff. Cheese ravioli was great as well. BEWARE THE PEPSI FORMULA IN ENGLAND IS ALTERED AND NOT FOR THE BETTER. The Lynchburg Lemonade is more like a reasonable facsimile by someone who overheard a friend talking about the recipe.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

exzMIT1gfugGu0Q4XgmfjA.text: Loved this place! Great place with no tourists. Great fish n chips. Great peas! Great beer. Can't go wrong at all.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

gEC5_34o_N2WKwkZPSMyQQ.text: Great neighborhood feel at this place, without being stuffy, or making tourists feel out of place.  Couples chatting, others playing cards and a family with a small toddler, wrapping up their early evening.  The 2 guy bartenders were efficient and friendly.  Standard London pub atmosphere with the same drill. Just order at the bar and have a seat.  Order the food at the bar too, and they'll bring it to you.  Wife had a craving for a traditional Sunday Pot roast dinner, and we got it nicely here.  Even delivery of an extra plate, because we were sharing was a nice touch. The food was spot on, but nothing spectacular.  Just family meals that are slowly being replaced too frequently with marked up gastropub fare.Nice 5 minute walk down the safe, back streets, lined with quaint London tiny houses.  The place offers a warm glow outside, and delivers the same on the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Pot roast dinner!
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Crisp and clean, London Ale
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Cozy all the way around.

n6cPxHLkNImQPkpnulruHQ.text: This is a very comfortable and friendly pub that is great for a low key lunch or drinks after work. I had the burger, and my husband had the fish & chips. I should have ordered chips with my burger instead of fries. Beer selection very nice and street very quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Weiss Beer
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

hh7rgK4UKHV21KEDTowMZw.text: Nice pub located on a really quiet block. We dropped by on a Saturday afternoon at around 3pm and the place was pretty empty. There were a few parties inside, but not many people. The menus were located right on the table and we helped ourselves to ordering the following at the bar:BRITISH ALE BATTERED COD WITH TRIPLE COOKED CHIPS AND MUSHY PEASReally good fish and chips dish. The cod was oddly-shaped on my dish, but nonetheless well-fried. This was probably one of the better, if not the best fish and chips I had in a pub in London! Yes, I know that's verrrry bold statement. There was a decent amount of chips on the dish, but not overwhelmingly a lot. As for the mushy peas, I was never a huge fan of them, but they were still ok despite my lack of interest in it.HOMEMADE CHICKEN POT PIE SERVED WITH CREAMY MASH AND ROASTED VEGThis was my girlfriend's dish so I didn't get to try much of it, but from what I tried and saw it was pretty good. First of all, the pie looked huge, but when she dug into it, we realized it was mostly hot air inside. We liked the chicken and the sauce was tasty. Also, there was a healthy serving of roasted potatoes and veggies to the side that mixed well.This was a really nice, quiet pub. There was plenty of spacing in between tables and seats and there was no overcrowding inside when we were there. The fish and chips were really good and absolutely was the most flavorful fish and chips we had tried in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Exterior
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Homemade chicken pot pie served with creamy mash and roasted veg

TX_UFxzYWKYZDrk_w4p8Cw.text: My son had eggs, ham and the triple fried chips, which are fantastic! Not at all greasy, but so crisp. The ham was delicious and grilled nicely. My husband had the bangers and mash, very rich and delicious. Beautiful presentation, too. I had a bacon cheeseburger. It was smoky and charred nicely. Very juicy and satisfying. One of our best meals in London.The staff were pleasant but not very attentive. Could be de rigeur for a pub. Overall, it was still a good experience.

6CHdwnzKrxx-uwFt4ZLeDQ.text: We came here for Sunday roast. We ordered the lamb, chicken, and the beef roast. Of course, we have to order some sweet potato fries to satisfy our cravings! They were delicious and plentiful, perfect for the midday roast we were expecting!

TjBZV2uKiFicOOvepauzuw.text: Very much enjoyed the chicken pie I had here before a concert at Royal Festival Hall, a quick 5 minute walk away.  Pie was generous and filled with all kinds of veggies, with more veggies and excellent chips alongside.  Ambience is casual and friendly, and prices were a real value.  My friend enjoyed his veggie burger and we'd both definitely return, especially if attending an after-dinner event nearby.  About a 15-minute walk from Southwark tube, less than 10 from Waterloo.

HvTISrcAj34pvcXIhbE8tg.text: Great pub.  Excellent food.  I had a burger my mate had a pie. Off the beating path, in a neighborhood, but worth the quick walk off the main Street.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

wdl3wCqR8pduUve1jaSZ4A.text: Kicked us out for having an 8 year old in the pub at 6:30 on Sunday, according to policy, while the place is 1/3 full. The "policy" is not posted on the website or on premise. We just wanted dinner. Go around the corner to the Kings Arms, kid (somewhat friendly) they are both pubs with restaurants.

nOYNMNOvIatjVay2jVDIwg.text: Cozy atmosphere.  Good selection of drinks.  Went on a Sunday and was pretty disappointed that no Sunday roast was being served.  It did mention beef, chicken or lamb options of Sunday roast on their chalkboard, but when I asked for the beef the barmaid was rather indignant in telling me there was no Sunday roast on the menu.....I mean it was Sunday, at 6:00 pm, in a pub, and it was written the board!Oh well.

KIaB6HbUu1cuPtvuWh8eOw.text: We chose this place on our last night in London, aiming for a typical London pub with that British pub feel and typical food. Totally found it! Love the look of this place. Cozy, small-ish size. 5 stars for cozyness.It was busy and tables were all full but we grabbed one drink and shortly one opened up. There seem to be no waiter service in London because nobody came to clean the previous people's food off of our table, we had to push it to the side until halfway through the meal when someone noticed. Also we didn't go to enough restaurants in London to tell, but I guess here you just order food at the bar? That seemed to be the way it was in 3 places we ate at.So we ordered up at the bar after waiting 20min for a waiter that never came. We were told one dish was sold out so we picked another. 20min later the bartender came over and told us the other dish was sold out, so I picked another and he left. Then he came back saying that one was also sold out!THIS is why I still give it 4 stars after all the food being sold out... What we did end up with (despite it not being our first, second, or third choice) was still amazing and exactly what we were looking for when we chose this pub. It was a beef pie and then fish & chips. I loved it all and was so satisfied with it being the last meal of the trip.Definitely go to this place if you get the chance and are nearby all the touristy areas. It's a short walk and is probably one of the more traditional home-y dining you'll get in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Amazing.

1wS3ae0vWDx60mI1RrVfxg.text: With only 3 days to spend in London, I was looking for a place where I could get the true British pub experience. The White Hart was the perfect choice. Very warm and inviting ambience with great beer, and incredible food (we had a pot pie and fish & Chips).I have to knock down to 4 stars because the kitchen was missing many of the menu items that we would have preferred to order but they ran out. So if you plan on coming here for dinner you may want to plan to arrive early in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips and pot pie

RL1KsdC2orqcdixEdv-ZVQ.text: Great fish and chips! Place is understated but gives a killer delivery on the drinks, food and atmosphere. A must got to pub!

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom

8jJo83un4qfAw-0y7tLfXA.text: Easy breezy lunch. Local fare at a reasonable price. Nice beer selection, too. If your looking for a quick hit lunch venue, this is a must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

OimuD2sTC98Yxao-ZaI1qA.text: Went there for a Sunday roast on a sunny day. What a nice place to go! I ordered a Mixed roast which was really tasty and they also have a great selection of bottles of beer.The place itself is not noisy and was nice to stay here after lunch to enjoy the sun coming from outside. I had a Kwak beer (I know it's strong but I love strong Belgian beers) and my friend had a coke.The roast,as I said, was really tasty and all the ingredients were properly cooked from the meat till the vegetables.The only con is the price :don't expect to spend less than 20£pp with for a Sunday roast and a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Mixed Sunday roast
Photo of The White Hart - London, United Kingdom. Kwak beer

M4KdN0VwF35IwD2dZSgVEg.text: Best meal we had in London- it's out of the way but worth a little extra walk. One had the burger one had fish and chips one had pulled pork pie. None disappointed. They were out of the Sunday roast beef so get there early on Sunday. Plenty of taps to try. Service friendly if a little inattentive.

UsFRdpqZZ5mseAVticKIgg.text: I popped in here for a glass of wine before dinner around 6:30 on a very nice day. It is quaint, great service and to my surprise was not obnoxiously packed. There is a decent amount of seating room here and a nice crowd- definitely not a dive or old pub.
